column4: can anyone tell me what is wrong with this line in /etc/fstab? or where any information about why the mount failed might be logged? //host/music /data/music    smbfs   guest,ro        0       0
I'm not an fstab/smbfs expert, but "guest" doesn't seem right to me.. maybe "username=guest"
I got that from man smbmount
Hence the "I'm not an fstab/smbfs expert" :)
What kind of error do you get?
You can also mount on a per-line basis by doing "mount /data/music" or "umount /data/music"
I don't get an error - it just doesn't mount at boot - I don't know where to look for an error
MAYBE your network isn't set up when that line is hit at bootup.
But that's as far as my knowledge goes... there might be a way to mount networked filesystems during boot--anyone?
any idea where to look in the logs to find out?
After bootup try just simply "mount /data/music" so that mount is forced to look at fstab.
do you mean, doing that will force whatever is in /etc/fstab to have an effect?
Yeah... if mount is given a path, it needs to look at /etc/fstab for extra information.

OK, then it's two likely possibilities: 1) During boot, trying to mount it before the network is ready; 2) During boot, trying to mount it before samba name lookup is ready.  Can you try specifying the IP address in /etc/fstab instead of the name? (DNS doesn't count :(...
using the IP address had no effect - but I could mount after boot with "sudo mount /data/music"
fwiw, I found similar problems on google, but no solutions
